main event: An unidentified object with a very bright long trail of fire was observed in Jacksonville, Florida on January 30, 1955.
interesting points: The observation was characterized as a ground-visual type,The sighting lasted for about 15 seconds,The object's description included a very bright aspect and a long trail of fire,The report suggests that the object could be a meteorite,There were civilian and military witnesses involved in the observation.
sighted object: one bright object with a long trail of fire
witness description: one civilian and one military air traffic controller
